summary.p: 8 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 21/1; Qurʾānic Text: Q 9:54-9:129; 11 lines per page; Dimensions: 294 x 178mm; Script style: kūfī A.I.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
Traces of old repair: upper and lower edges possibly have been cropped.
Old accession number: A. 21 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1–8. 178×294 мм (1.65). Support: thick (except fol. 1) semitransparent parchment, smooth on the hair side, darkish, of yellowish color. Writing material: light brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 3 and 8, 4 and 7, 5 and 6 are bifolia, fol. 2 is a singleton with a stub, fol. 1 has lost its counterfolio.
I: H1F F2H H3F F4H H5F / F6H H7F F8H S

Text layout: 135×225 mm (1.666), 11 lines. Ruling: with a hard-point tool, punctures on the outer margins. Script: A I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: l absent.

Verse markers: for individual verses – diagonal dashes (type1.1.1) in the same ink as the main text; for groups of five verses – letter alif drawn in red paint and black ink over the markers of individual verses; for groups of ten verses – circles (type1.D.I) in red paint and black ink over the markers of individual verses; for 100th verse – two interlacing ovals in red paint outlined with ink, over the marker for an individual verse (fol. 5v).
Stitching: fragments of threads have been preserved in the punctures
Defects: stains and traces of moisture; the lower corner of fol. 1 is wrinkled; ink has peeled off on some places.
Attached materials: small sheet of paper (fol. I) with the annotation in French written in brown ink.
Fol. 1r–8v. Surah 9, verses 54(54) – 130(129)*. Incipit: [إلاّ وهُمْ] كارهون. Explicit: وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
